titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Charles Barber papers related to Alexander Siloti M2112
titlestmt.author: Gurudarshan Khalsa

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-05-03 13:22:23 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Charles Barber papers related to Alexander Siloti
did.langmaterial: The materials are primarily in English and Russian. Other languages include German and French.
did.physloc: Special Collections materials are stored offsite and must be paged 36 hours in advance. For more information on paging collections, see the department's website: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/spc.html.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: Research papers of Charles Barber for two of his publications on Alexander Siloti: Lost in the Stars (https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/4807486) and The Alexander Siloti Collection (https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/5462577).

The materials include Charles Barber’s correspondence with Siloti family members, museums, archives and libraries, as well as published music scores, publications, newspaper clippings and research notes. Also included are photocopied and handwritten copies of Alexander Siloti’s correspondence as well as music scores, concert programs, posters, newspaper clippings and publications.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series:
Series 1: Research Materials. Series 2: Music Scores

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles Barber papers related to Alexander Siloti, M2112. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

accessrestrict.head: Publication Rights
accessrestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical and digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Alexander Siloti (1863-1945) was a Russian-born pianist, conductor and arranger. He studied at the Moscow Conservatory and after graduating went to Leipzig, Germany to study under Franz Liszt. Siloti taught at the Moscow Philharmonic and worked as an editor for Peter Ilich Tchaikovsky. He married Vera Tretyakova, the daughter of the industrialist Pavel Tretyakova and toured Europe and America with his wife and children from 1892-1900. He organized, financed, and conducted the Siloti Concerts in St Petersburg, introducing many important and influential musicians and composers. He was Intendant at the Mariinsky Theatre and briefly a teacher at the Petrograd Conservatory before fleeing from what had become the Soviet Union to Finland. Siloti eventually moved to America and taught at the Julliard School.
Throughout his life Siloti corresponded with many influential composers and others in the music world, such as Tchaikovsky and Liszt.

Dr. Charles Barber is a conductor active in concert, opera, and recordings, and a teacher in the history and aesthetics of conducting. Charles Barber earned a Bachelor of Music from the University of Victoria; Master of Arts from Stanford; and, Doctor of Musical Arts from Stanford. He was a student of the conductor Carlos Kleiber, and served in apprenticeship with the San Francisco Opera and the Metropolitan Opera. Barber was an assistant to composer and arranger Marty Paich working on recording projects and on films. He was a Visiting Assistant Professor at Stanford and created the Charles Barber Conductors on Film Collection (https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/10401369). He has served as a producer to Naxos Records, the world’s largest classical company, and in 1997 created American Classics, a series that has now over 300 CDs in release. Barber has conducted in Canada and the United States, and on tour in South Korea, Singapore, Japan, Morocco and Spain. He has served as the Conductor and Artistic Director of the City Opera Vancouver, Canada.

Charles Barber corresponded with Kyriena Siloti, Alexander Siloti’s daughter and with Maria Siloti, who married Siloti’s son Levko Siloti and studied piano under Siloti, as well as with other Siloti family members. He also wrote to museums, archives, universities and libraries in the United States, the United Kingdom, the Russian Federation/Soviet Union and Germany to find materials related to Siloti.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series documents Charles Barber’s research for his books about Alexander Siloti. The materials include Charles Barber’s correspondence with Siloti family members, museums, archives and libraries, as well as research notes, newspaper clippings, publications and music sheets. Also included are photocopied and handwritten copies of Alexander Siloti’s correspondence as well as music sheets, concert programs, posters, newspaper clippings and publications about Alexander Siloti.
The files in this series have been kept in their original order with mostly original folder headings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of music sheets, programs and posters from concerts Siloti organized in Russia. Also includes Charles Barber correspondence, research and notebooks. The languages include: English, Russian, German, Dutch and French.

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and a photocopy of the original sheet music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Levko Alexandrovich Siloti was Alexander Siloti's youngest son. He married Mary Alberta Mueller (Maria, Mussy) who studied piano with Siloti. Materials include correspondence and an excerpt from a manuscript Maria wrote about their life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence and publication list. CB/BH Music was a company formed by Charles Barber and Bruce Herman.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include correspondence, posters, concert programs and photocopies of publications and articles from archives, museums and libraries in the United States, Britain, Germany and Russia. There is also Charles Barber correspondence with these institutions. Languages include English, Russian, German and French.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include index cards, research notes, cards from catalog and photocopies of publications. Languages are in English and Russian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of publications, magazines and journals. Also includes Charles Barber correspondence. Languages are in German, French, English and Russian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of publications, magazines and journals. Also includes Charles Barber correspondence. Languages are in German, French, English and Russian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of publications with annotations and notes by Charles Barber. Languages include German and English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Charles Barber correspondence with archives, museums and libraries regarding materials on Alexander Siloti.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include Charles Barber correspondence and photocopies of Alexander Siloti materials from the Rud. Ibach Sohn archives. Rud. Ibach Sohn is a German company that manufactures pianos.

did.unittitle: International Piano Archive at the University of Maryland College Park

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Charles Barber correspondence and research notes. Also includes photocopies of publications and liner notes from Siloti's recordings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence between Charles Barber and Alex Siloti, Alexander Siloti's grandson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Charles Barber research notes and correspondence with Kyriena Siloti. Kyriena Siloti was Alexander Siloti's daughter.

did.unittitle: My Memories of Liszt by Alexander Siloti

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and questionnaires for students who studied piano under Alexander Siloti.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photocopies and handwritten copies of correspondence between Tchaikovsky and Siloti. Also includes correspondence between Maria Siloti and Charles Barber. Materials are in Russian and English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series 2: Series 2 consists of published and manuscript music scores, mainly from Alexander Siloti, Levko Siloti or Maria Siloti’s music collection of major composers including, Arensky, Bach, Balakirev, Chopin, Liszt, Rachmaninoff, Rubinstein and Tchaikovsky. Many of the scores are annotated.

The series is in original order and is arranged alphabetically by composer and by title. It contains a mixture of originals and photocopies. Some of the scores also include correspondence from Maria Siloti to Charles Barber explaining the importance or context of a particular score with regards to Alexander Siloti.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
